DOC.HEAD: Briton With Amnesia Found Wandering in France
DOC.TEXT: A Briton apparently unable to remember his name or where he comes from was discovered wandering about northern France, police said Sunday. A passer-by found the man, dressed in corduroy trousers, a beige pullover sweater and a checked parka, soaking wet on the banks of the Somme river in the center of Abbeville, about 100 miles north of Paris. The man, about 40 years old, was taken to a hospital but was unable to remember his name or reason for being in France, police said. Carrying no papers, he identified himself first as Richard Davis, then Richard Jackson and could not provide his hometown. Police interrogated him for three days and he told them he believed he had visited France before. He bore no sign of injury and did not appear to be a homeless person, police said. French authorities contacted British officials to see whether anyone of similar description was reported missing in Britain.
